message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Placing the infant in a supine position on a supportive mattress while sleeping is the recommended sleeping position for infants to prevent sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS). Keeping the infant covered and maintaining a high room temperature may increase the risk of SIDS. Using a device or avoiding pacifier use during sleep is not recommended for SIDS prevention.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Placing the infant in a supine position on a firm mattress while sleeping is the recommended safest sleep position to prevent sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS). Keeping the infant covered and maintaining a high room temperature, application of a device to maintain the sleeping position, and avoiding pacifier use during sleep are not recommended and may actually increase the risk of SIDS.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Placing the infant in a supine position on a firm mattress while sleeping is the recommended sleeping position for infants to prevent sudden unexpected infant death syndrome (SUIDS). Keeping the infant covered and maintaining a high room temperature can increase the risk of SUIDS. Application of a device to maintain the sleeping position and avoiding pacifier use during sleep are not recommended measures for preventing SUIDS.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS) is most common in infants who sleep on their stomachs or sides. Placing the infant in a supine position on a firm mattress can prevent SIDS. Keeping the infant covered and maintaining a high room temperature increases the risk of SIDS. Application of a device to maintain the sleeping position may increase the risk of suffocation or entrapment. Pacifier use during sleep has actually been shown to decrease the risk of SIDS.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Placing the baby in a supine position on a firm mattress is recommended to prevent sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS). Keeping the baby covered and maintaining a high room temperature can increase the risk of SIDS. Using a device to maintain the sleeping position and avoiding pacifier use during sleep are not recommended strategies for preventing SIDS.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Placing the infant in a supine position on a firm mattress while sleeping can help prevent sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) by reducing the risk of suffocation or inhalation of carbon dioxide. The other options do not provide preventive measures for SIDS and may actually increase the risk of suffocation or overheating.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Placing the infant in a supine position on a firm mattress while sleeping is known as the "Back to Sleep" campaign and has been shown to significantly reduce the risk of sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS). Keeping the infant covered and maintaining a high room temperature can increase the risk of overheating and SIDS. The use of a device to maintain sleeping position and avoiding pacifier use during sleep have not been shown to prevent SIDS.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Placing the infant in a supine position on a firm mattress while sleeping is the recommended position to prevent sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS). Keeping the infant covered and maintaining a high room temperature can increase the risk of SIDS. Application of a device to maintain the sleeping position and avoiding pacifier use during sleep have not been shown to prevent SIDS.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Placing the infant in a supine position on a firm mattress while sleeping is the recommended safe sleep position to reduce the risk of sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS). Keeping the infant covered and maintaining a high room temperature, application of a device to maintain the sleeping position or avoiding pacifier use during sleep are not recommended preventive measures for SIDS.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Placing the infant in a supine position on a firm mattress while sleeping is the recommended precaution to prevent sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS). Keeping the infant covered and maintaining a high room temperature, application of a device to maintain the sleeping position, and avoiding pacifier use during sleep are not recommended precautions for preventing SIDS.
